For those having problems on how to play the video or missing the subtitles.

For those having problems playing the video, just install CCCP on your computer using the default settings. Make sure to remove codec conflicts before installation, aka. having other conflicting codec packs. Play the video Windows Media Player Classic Home Cinema that comes with CCCP in playing the video. And then viola! HD quality videos!

For those having problems with the subtitle not showing up, open the Windows Media Player Classic Home Cinema that comes with CCCP. Click the VIEW then OPTIONS. Under the PLAYBACK tab in the OPEN SETTINGS section, you will there a check-box that says AUTO-LOAD SUBTITLES and make sure that is checked. And then viola! You will now see the subtitles!

Hope it works for you since it worked for me! :)
